@graph.headline: What Is Few-Shot Prompting: Making AI Actually Do What You Want
@graph.description: Few-shot prompting is a technique that guides large language models by providing several examples directly within the prompt to demonstrate a specific task and desired output format.

@graph.name: What Is Few-Shot Prompting: Making AI Actually Do What You Want

hasDefinedTerm.name: Few-Shot Prompting
hasDefinedTerm.description: A technique that guides large language models by providing several examples, or 'shots,' directly within the prompt to demonstrate a specific task and desired output format.

hasDefinedTerm.name: In-Context Learning
hasDefinedTerm.description: The ability of a model to recognize patterns from examples provided in the prompt and apply those patterns to new requests without changing its internal parameters.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Large Language Models
hasDefinedTerm.description: Massive neural networks trained on vast amounts of text data that can understand and generate human-like text.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Prompt Engineering
hasDefinedTerm.description: The practice of designing and optimizing prompts to effectively communicate with and guide AI language models.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Chain-of-Thought Prompting
hasDefinedTerm.description: A technique that includes step-by-step reasoning in examples to teach models how to think through complex problems.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Self-Consistency
hasDefinedTerm.description: A method that generates multiple reasoning paths and selects the most common answer to improve reliability.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Context Window
hasDefinedTerm.description: The maximum amount of text that a language model can process in a single prompt.

@graph.name: How to Create an Effective Few-Shot Prompt
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to building a well-structured few-shot prompt for AI language models.

step.name: Define the Task
step.text: Write a clear, concise task description that explains what you want the model to do.

step.name: Create Quality Examples
step.text: Provide 2-5 high-quality input-output pairs that demonstrate the task perfectly and cover different scenarios.

step.name: Ensure Consistent Formatting
step.text: Use clear labels like 'Input:' and 'Output:' and maintain the same structure for every example.

step.name: Add Your Query
step.text: Present your new input in the exact same format as your examples.

step.name: Include Trailing Label
step.text: Add a label like 'Output:' or 'Sentiment:' to cue the model to start generating.

@graph.name: Few-Shot Prompting Techniques Comparison
@graph.description: Comparison of different few-shot prompting methods, their core concepts, performance impact, and key researchers.

@graph.name: Advantages of Few-Shot Prompting
@graph.description: Key benefits of using few-shot prompting techniques

itemListElement.name: Less Data Needed
itemListElement.description: Stop worrying about massive datasets for every little thing

itemListElement.name: Saves Money
itemListElement.description: Avoids the huge computational costs of model fine-tuning

itemListElement.name: Fast & Flexible
itemListElement.description: Prototype and launch new AI solutions in a flash

itemListElement.name: Total User Control
itemListElement.description: Directly steer the model's output with your examples

itemListElement.name: Incredibly Versatile
itemListElement.description: A single model can be taught to do countless different tasks

itemListElement.name: Better Performance
itemListElement.description: Delivers far better results than just asking a question with no examples

itemListElement.name: Accessible to All
itemListElement.description: Lowers the barrier for using advanced AI effectively

@graph.name: Limitations of Few-Shot Prompting
@graph.description: Key challenges and limitations when using few-shot prompting

itemListElement.name: Context Window Limits
itemListElement.description: You can only provide so many examples due to token limitations

itemListElement.name: Prompt Sensitivity
itemListElement.description: Performance is highly dependent on exact formatting and wording

itemListElement.name: Risk of Bias
itemListElement.description: Your examples can accidentally teach the model bad habits

itemListElement.name: Inconsistent Results
itemListElement.description: Can sometimes be less consistent than fine-tuned models

@graph.name: OpenAI
@graph.description: AI research company that developed GPT-3 and demonstrated the effectiveness of few-shot prompting

@graph.name: Google Research
@graph.description: Research division of Google that advanced few-shot prompting with Chain-of-Thought and Self-Consistency techniques

@graph.name: GPT-3
@graph.description: Large language model developed by OpenAI that demonstrated the power of few-shot prompting

@graph.name: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
@graph.citation: Brown, T. B., et al. (2020). Language Models are Few-Shot Learners. OpenAI.
